channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11006] Cannot create 'data' table
item.description:
Starting with HBase 0.96, it is not possible to create a table named 'data'. When a user tries to create a table named 'data', the table is added to the metastore but the region server fails to open the region.

To reproduce, I just run “hbase shell” and type in:
create ‘data’, ‘cf’

This was also verified on Apache HBase trunk by Enis from the Hortornworks forums. His comment on the bug:
There has been a change in the directory layout in HBase 0.96 for introducing namespaces. The HBase root directory now keeps all table data under the sub-directory “data”. I suspect the error is somewhere there.

More info can be found on the thread in the Hortornworks forums:
http://hortonworks.com/community/forums/topic/cannot-create-data-table/

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Thanks Gregory. This also applied to some other table names as well like lib, etc. The problem is in the HConstants.HBASE_NON_TABLE_DIRS.

This is easily reproducible, and instead of throwing an exception and not allowing the table creation, or this working as expected, the bug results in the region not being able to open.
This looks like a low hanging fruit for 0.99. Good for newcomers!

+    if (HConstants.HBASE_NON_TABLE_DIRS.contains(tableName)) {

+      LOG.info("Is not allowed create tables names with: " +

The log should be warn or error, right ?

do we still have the problems of the reserved names?
before 96 we had the problem because the table were located in the /hbase root dir
so they conflicted with the "reserved ones".
but now, everything is inside /hbase/data/ and we shouldn't have system stuff there
so, you should be able to create /hbase/data/default/data or /hbase/data/myns/data and others
Agreed with Matteo. The solution is not to disallow table name creation, but to fix the bug in region opening.

Ted Yu,

The log should be warn or error, right ?

I will change to warn log level

Here is the stack trace, from the above mentioned forum:


I see this error message on the region server:

2014-04-15 17:18:20,334 INFO [Priority.RpcServer.handler=4,port=60020] regionserver.HRegionServer: Open data,,1397607500120.eeb4db6dcc5606cef034531f8048db27.

2014-04-15 17:18:20,334 WARN [Priority.RpcServer.handler=4,port=60020] regionserver.HRegionServer: Failed opening region data,,1397607500120.eeb4db6dcc5606cef034531f8048db27.

java.io.IOException: No descriptor found for non table = data

at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.FSTableDescriptors.get(FSTableDescriptors.java:154)

at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.HRegionServer.openRegion(HRegionServer.java:3506)

at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.AdminProtos$AdminService$2.callBlockingMethod(AdminProtos.java:19795)

at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer.call(RpcServer.java:2146)

at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer$Handler.run(RpcServer.java:1851)

Thanks, Matteo Bertozzi, Enis Soztutar and Ted Yu

I will fix the region opening.

if you do a grep in the code base there are other places where HBASE_NON_USER_TABLE_DIRS is used,
and I think that we can remove all the HBASE_NON_TABLE_DIRS from it.

http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12641848/HBASE-11006-v2.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12641848

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

My apologies on dropping the ball on this one. Will review this for 0.99.1.
Can we add 0.98 as fix version as well?
this was fixed by HBASE-12054 which is already in 0.98, 1.0, master
